items.title: For CEOs: burnout, exodus and breath control
items.description: A record number of CEOs have announced this year that they’re stepping down: 1,991 and counting.

items.title: Disposable vapes axed in Belgium in European first to stem youth addiction
items.description: Belgium eliminates single-use e-cigarettes to curb rising nicotine dependence among the young.

items.title: Considering Dry January? Here’s what experts say you’ll gain (and lose)
items.description: Does Dry January change drinking habits for the long haul? The evidence is mixed but promising for those who approach it mindfully.

items.title: Kremlin threatens retaliation as European Telegram ban of Russian state media sparks outrage
items.description: With Europe’s crackdown on Russian state media intensifying, the country's foreign ministry threatens payback.

items.title: MacKenzie Scott’s game-changing philanthropy still mystifies nonprofits: ‘Her gifts are super generous, but unfortunately, they don’t provide long term sustainability’
